knownIssues.description: Database path resolution creates nested mac_tools/mac_tools/ directory structure
knownIssues.impact: System appears broken (0 documents) when functional (56,799 documents)
knownIssues.rootCause: Path resolution logic in Swift incorrectly handles relative paths when executed from mac_tools directory
knownIssues.resolution: DatabasePathResolver class implemented with comprehensive path resolution strategy

knownIssues.description: Chat UI grows vertically downwards indefinitely, creating poor user experience
knownIssues.workaround: Manual scrolling required for long conversations
knownIssues.impact: Degrades user experience as conversations become difficult to navigate and visually overwhelming
knownIssues.rootCause: Missing fixed height container with proper scrolling implementation

decisions.decision: Prioritize database path resolution bug fix over all Week 6+ features
decisions.rationale: Critical bug creates false negative system state that blocks development and creates unreliable user experience
alternatives: Continue with Week 6 features and fix later
decisions.impact: Delays Week 6+ roadmap but ensures system reliability

decisions.decision: Apply temporary manual fix while developing permanent solution
decisions.rationale: Enables continued testing and validation while permanent fix is developed
alternatives: Wait for permanent fix before proceeding
decisions.impact: System operational with 56,799 documents accessible for testing

decisions.decision: Implement DatabasePathResolver as centralized path resolution utility
decisions.rationale: Comprehensive solution eliminates path ambiguity, provides environment variable flexibility, and ensures working directory independence
decisions.impact: Permanent solution enables reliable system operation and unblocks Week 6+ development

decisions.decision: Resume Week 6-8 advanced AI feature development immediately
decisions.rationale: Database path resolution blocker eliminated, system fully operational with 56,799 documents, all technical foundations in place
decisions.impact: Restores development velocity and progress toward production-ready AI assistant

decisions.decision: Prioritize modern chat UI implementation based on 2024-2025 best practices research
decisions.rationale: Current UI has critical usability flaw (infinite vertical growth) that degrades user experience. Research shows dark mode reduces eye strain by 67%, animations make wait times feel 20% shorter, and 90% of users abandon slow applications
alternatives: Simple CSS fixes without comprehensive redesign
Focus on feature completion over UX
decisions.impact: Addresses critical UX blocker and aligns with modern user expectations for AI chat interfaces

decisions.decision: Implement comprehensive tool capability mapping with Playwright testing
decisions.rationale: System has extensive tool functionality but lacks visibility and reliability validation. Comprehensive mapping and testing ensures users understand capabilities and prevents regressions
alternatives: Focus on new features over existing tool validation
decisions.impact: Establishes reliable foundation for tool ecosystem and improves user confidence in system capabilities
